intro: Talinella grevei subsp. sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping talinella, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
